items.name: 27.01 British Culture Archive
items.summary: Holidays In The Sun // DDH Double IPA
items.desc:
8.7% ABV // 1.082 OG // 7 EBC // 20 IBU // 440ML
INGREDIENTS: Malted BARLEY (GLUTEN), WHEAT (GLUTEN), OATS (GLUTEN), Dextrose, Hops, Yeast
This DIPA forms the first in a new patrons series in collaboration with the British Culture Archive. The series will be IPA focused, but also intended to showcase some of the progression in the UK hops over the past few years, pairing them with a US variety to show that homegrown varieties can deliver on many of the big, citrus flavours we love from the pacific northwest.
First up we’ve selected Olicana, a variety which has been around for a few years now and still is up there amongst the forefront of UK hops. Olicana stands out for its impressive aromas of mango and passion fruit, backed up by nectarine and apricot notes, and a pleasant floral character. We paired this with one of our current favourite US varieties in Idaho 7, a real allrounder that can be relied upon for plenty of ripe tropical fruit of its own whether used hot side or in the dry hop. In this case, we went with both, as we loaded the whirlpool of this oat-filled NE DIPA with Idaho 7 before drying hopping with both varieties to a combined total of 26g/l.

items.name: 28.01 Leimai Lemaow
items.summary: Astro Gary // Rainbow Astro Belt Sour IPA
items.desc:
6.5% ABV // 1.0735 OG // 6 EBC // 15 IBU // 440ML
INGREDIENTS: Malted BARLEY (GLUTEN), OATS (GLUTEN), LACTOSE (MILK), Mango Puree, Raspberry Puree, Orange Juice Concentrate, Lime Juice Concentrate, Hops, Yeast
FOR THIS NEW PATRONS PROJECT SERIES WITH LEIMAI LEMAOW, WE’RE GOING
TO BE TAKING A TRIP TO THE SWEET SIDE. LEIMAI IS A SELF-PROCLAIMED CANDY NUT, SO WE’LL BE TAKING OUR INSPIRATION FOR THE SERIES FROM HER PERSONAL FAVOURITE SWEETS, TO CREATE TASTES OF CHILDHOOD IN LIQUID FORM.
First up, a sour IPA inspired by the colours and flavours of rainbow Astro Belts. We started with a simple hazy IPA base of pale barley malt and plenty of oats, backed up with lactose to round out the mouthfeel. We whirlpool hopped with Citra BBC and then fermented with our house IPA yeast strain.
We selected fruits to represent the colours of the candy that we felt worked well together. Leading with the ripe fruit flavours of mango puree and orange juice, we followed up with plenty of tangy raspberry puree, and finally, a touch of zingy lime juice to give a sour accent to the finish.

items.name: Enter The Haze
items.desc:
The humble IPA has been on an incredible journey. With it’s origins in England the style quickly took over the world. Initial American attempts to re-create this classic British style with big, bold US hops led the first West Coast IPA’s, over the last decade we’ve seen the style evolve again. Here we combine higher dry hopping with a water profile and yeast that gives stone and tropical fruit flavor and a hazier appearance to the beer. This is one of our favourite styles of beer and we’re proud to have championed it over the years.
Cases contain:
4 x FAITH
4 X STRIDING EDGE
4 X HEATHEN
All for £32!
